# Standing Offer for Decontamination and Demolition Services in the Quebec Region

### Tender Information

- **Competition Identifier**: EF928-230131 – Standing Offer for Decontamination and Demolition Services, Quebec Region
- **Amendment Number**: 1
- **Status**: Expiration
- **Publication Date**: July 18, 2023
- **Closing Date**: August 31, 2023, 2 PM EST

### Description of the Decontamination and Demolition Services Requirement

The Department of Public Works and Government Services (PSPC) has published a Request for Standing Offer (RFSA) to obtain specialized construction services for the removal and disposal of hazardous materials, including asbestos, mold, lead-based paint, and bird droppings, as well as for insulation, demolition, and/or deconstruction work. The standing offers will be awarded for a maximum period of 2 years with the possibility of 2 option years.

### Stand Offer Evaluation Criteria

The evaluation criteria will be based on the lowest price. A maximum of 4 standing offers will be issued, allocating work volumes as follows:

* 30% to the first ranked Offeror
* 30% to the second ranked Offeror
* 20% to the third ranked Offeror
* 20% to the fourth ranked Offeror

### Commercial Agreement Guidelines

This Request for Standing Offer may be accessed by eligible suppliers in the following agreement guidelines:

* Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
* World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
* Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
* Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)
* Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
* Canada-UK Trade Continuity Agreement (Canada-UK TCA)
* Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
* Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-Ukraine Free Trade Agreement (CUFTA)
* Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
* Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)

### Eligibility

The Request for Standing Offer will be open to any eligible supplier who meets the criteria listed in the solicitation.
